---

## SDQ vs ECBQ

A frequent scenario encountered by psychologists includes the comparison between different psychometric evaluation tools such as the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and Early Childhood Behavior Questionnaire (ECBQ). Given the differences in language and context of each questionnaire, matching items within these tools becomes a cumbersome task. This is where Harmony comes as a resourceful tool in addressing the challenge of harmonisation. Harmony, which uses big language models, can provide a percentage match between individual items in SDQ and ECBQ. # Why Use Harmony for SDQ vs ECBQ? The distinct language and context presented in both these questionnaires needs a meticulous matching process for an accurate comparison. Harmony, with its state-of-the-art AI and natural language processing, provides an effortless way to harmonise the items in SDQ vs ECBQ. With its user-friendly interface, researchers can either select the instruments from the database or directly upload the PDF forms of the questionnaire on Harmony's website. They can easily compare and contrast SDQ and ECBQ even if the questionnaires are in different languages, a feature that sets Harmony apart. # Harmony in Action: Simplifying SDQ vs ECBQ To illustrate, let's discuss how Harmony might help in comparing the items in SDQ vs ECBQ. In SDQ, an item may state "Your child is often unhappy, downhearted, or tearful", whereas in ECBQ a similar sentiment might be indicated in the item "During everyday activities, how often did your twins seem full of energy, even in the evening". Harmony uses powerful AI to detect the similarity between the items, thus simplifying the comparative process. Thus Harmony, offering a streamlined process to compare SDQ vs ECBQ, is an invaluable tool for psychologists and researchers alike.

## Compare the items in SDQ and ECBQ
